p: The genus Mentha, popularly known in Brazil as “hortelãs, hortelã-pimenta, menta, menta-inglesa, hortelã-apimentada, hortelã das cozinhas and sândalo,” includes 25–30 species that are known mainly due to the characteristic and refreshing taste. It is native to Europe and was brought by settlers to Brazil, where it is cultivated as medicinal plant in gardens [ 6, 7].
